# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

No special instructions were provided.

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function along with an example:

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int = 10)
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) <= text_width
            # Add word to current line
            line *= " $word"
        else
            # Start a new line with the current word
            println(line)
            line = "$word"
        end
    end
    println(line)
end

# Example usage:
words = ["Here's", "a", "lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet"]
wrap_string(words)
```

This example will wrap the words in the `words` array according to the specified `text_width`.
